isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - INSTALL - NINE-, TEN-, AND THIRTEEN-SPEED TRANSMISSIONS

note.para: The auxiliary case must be in the LO range so that the case can be installed with the gears timed correctly.

step1.para: Use an air gun to apply air pressure to the LO range port in the piston housing to put the case in the LO range.
On Design Level 1 Transmissions, if removed, install the snap rings in the bores for the cups for the auxiliary countershafts in the main case ( Figure 338).

figure.caption: Figure 338. Install Snap Rings in Bores

step1.para: If removed, install the bearing cups for the auxiliary countershaft in the bores in the main case. Clean the outer diameter of the cups.
On Design Level 1 Transmissions, make sure the cup is against the snap ring (Figure 338).
On Design Level 2 Transmissions, make sure the cup is against the step in the bore (Figure 339).

figure.caption: Figure 339. Make Sure Cup is Against Step in Bore

step1.para: Use a sealant dispenser and Loctite RTV Sealant #5699 to put a new sealant pattern for the auxiliary case on the transmission case a 3 mm (1/8 inch) bead in the pattern shown in Figure 340. Put a sealant pattern around each puller hole in the auxiliary case as shown in Figure 340. Refer to INSTALLING THE SEALANTsection.

warning.para: When using a hammer and steel drift, wear safe eye protection and make sure the tools are in safe condition. Do not use tools that are worn or damaged (mushroomed). If the tools are not in safe condition, pieces can break and cause serious personal injury.

step1.para: If the dowels have been removed, use a steel drift and a hammer to install the dowels. Install the dowels from the back of the main case flange. Install the dowels until the ends of the dowels are 64 mm (2.5 inches) from the flange (Figure 341).
Lubricate the dowel pins with new oil that is used in the transmission. Refer to GROUP 10- LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Connect a lifting bracket to the auxiliary case.
If a transmission jack is used, remove the bottom two bolts from the output bearing retainer. Use bolts to connect a bracket for the jack to the retainer (Figure 342).

figure.caption: Figure 342. Remove Bottom Two Bolts From Output Bearing Retainer

step1.para: If an overhead hoist is used, connect brackets to the transmission case bolts (Figure 343).

figure.caption: Figure 343. Connect Brackets to Transmission Case Bolts

note.para: The auxiliary section must be in the LO range and the main case must be in gear to install the auxiliary case.

step1.para: Install the auxiliary case. Make sure the dowel holes in the auxiliary case are aligned with the dowels in the main case and that the auxiliary case is evenly installed on the dowels. Rotate the input shaft so that the teeth on the auxiliary drive gear align with the teeth on the countershaft driven gears (Figure 344).
Remove the lifting bracket(s) and the lifting device from the auxiliary case.
Install the auxiliary case against the transmission case. If necessary, use a rubber or plastic mallet to push the auxiliary case against the main case.
Install the mounting bolts and washers for the auxiliary case. Tighten the bolts to 47 to 61 Nm (35 to 45 ft-lbs. (Figure 345).

figure.caption: Figure 345. Install Mounting Bolts and Washers for Auxiliary Case

step1.para: Check and adjust the end play of each auxiliary countershaft. Do the procedure described in ADJUSTMENT, AUXILIARY COUNTERSHAFT END PLAY section. The correct end play is 0.051 to 0.152 mm (0.002 to 0.006).

Connect the BLUE air line to the HI range port of the piston housing. Connect the BLACK air line to the LO range port of the piston housing. Connect the RED air line to the supply port of the filter and regulator assembly (Figure 346).

figure.caption: Figure 346. Connect Air Lines to Ports
